body.p: Networking is a virtual networking service that leverages the OpenStack Neutron service to provide network connectivity and addressing to Compute service devices.
The Networking service also provides an API to configure and manage a variety of network services.
You can use the Networking service to connect guest servers or you can define and configure your own virtual network topology.

section.title: Network Separation in Neutron
section.p: Network separation is the name given to the practice of segregating network traffic by types. The primary reasons to employ network separation are to increase performance and security. Having a dedicated channel enables a network administrator to exercise better control over the SLA provided to the tenant. Network separation is often implemented as part of a security policy that is enforced by the security practices in the organization.

There are two types of network separation: physical and logical. Both are the same in that they create separate channels for traffic types. For example, a best practice is to create separate channel for storage (iSCSI) traffic. This can be accomplished by creating a logical separation using VLAN on a single network interface card (NIC) or by dedicating a NIC for this type of traffic. In the cloud today, management, tenant, external and services traffic types are segregated into their own channels.

section.title: Multiple Networks
section.p: The multiple networks feature in HPE Helion OpenStack enables bridging of multiple external physical networks to Neutron network. Using this functionality, a tenant can dictate the path taken by the data in the physical network outside the cloud. It can also be used for multihoming to two physical networks.

section.title: Configuring the Networking service
section.p: Helion Network Administrators are responsible for planning for the Neutron networking service, and once installed, to configure the service to meet the needs of their cloud network users.

section.title: Working with the Networking service
section.p: To perform tasks using the Networking service, you can use the dashboard, API or CLI.

section.title: Reconfiguring the Networking service
section.p: If you change any of the network configuration after installation, it is recommended that you reconfigure the Networking service by running the neutron-reconfigure playbook.
